title.narrative: HIV-Innovations for Improved Patient Outcomes in South Africa

description.narrative: The purpose of this program is to support South African organizations that identify, strengthen, and institutionalize better, cost-effective practices and innovations in HIV and AIDS care and treatment for priority and at-risk populations in accordance with South African government (SAG) priorities and policies. Targeted priority and at-risk populations for this program include pregnant women; infants, children, and adolescents; men who have sex with men (MSM); commercial sex workers (CSWs); hard to reach populations; and those co-infected with HIV/TB. This program will support the scale-up of SAG priorities through capacity building, operations research, including cost and cost effectiveness analyses, monitoring and evaluation, and plans for transition of limited service provision to key populations. Successful programs will demonstrate a strong capacity for integration of policy, technical approaches, as well as collaboration and coordination with partners and stakeholders and must also be in accordance with the Partnership Framework between the USG and SAG...O
